```{r echo = FALSE}

library(tidyverse)

```

```{r}
DATA <- read_csv("data/ConvertedSalts_Clean.csv")

```

Going to work on ion stuff here.

Seawater salinity = 35,000 ppm
```{r}


DATA %>% 
  filter(Measurement %in% c("CaCO3","Ca2+", "NaHCO3", "NaCl", "KCl", "Cl-", "K+", "Na+", "MgCl2")) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Measurement, y = Min_Concentration_ppm))+
  geom_boxplot()+
  theme_classic()

#length(DATA$Measurement[DATA$Measurement == "HCO3-"])                                     
                                           
unique(DATA$Measurement)


```



```{r}

#Lets remove extreme values for now

DATA %>% 
  filter(Measurement %in% c("Specific Conductance","Salinity", "Total Dissolved Solids")) %>%
  mutate(Min_Conductivity_uScm = ifelse(Min_Conductivity_uScm > 10000, NA, Min_Conductivity_uScm),
              Max_Conductivity_uScm = ifelse(Max_Conductivity_uScm > 60000, NA, Max_Conductivity_uScm))%>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Measurement, y = Max_Conductivity_uScm))+
  geom_violin(aes(colour = "#1268FF"), alpha = 0.3)+
  geom_violin(aes(y = Min_Conductivity_uScm, colour = "#3268FF"), alpha = 0.3)+
  #geom_jitter(height = 0, width = 0.3)+
  scale_y_continuous(trans='log10')+
  theme_classic()

#Without extreme values removed
DATA %>% 
  filter(Measurement %in% c("Specific Conductance","Salinity", "Total Dissolved Solids")) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Measurement, y = Max_Conductivity_uScm))+
  geom_violin(aes(colour = "#1268FF"), alpha = 0.3)+
  geom_violin(aes(y = Min_Conductivity_uScm, colour = "#3268FF"), alpha = 0.3)+
  #geom_jitter(height = 0, width = 0.3)+
  scale_y_continuous(trans='log10')+
  theme_classic()


```
